channel.title: [tut] html table basics
channel.description:
[size=20pt]imjohn10's guide to the basics of tables in html.[/size] first you have to put the table tags on like so [code]
[/code] some common attributes for this are border="#" sets the border size cellpadding="#" space from text or picture to cell border cellspaceing="#" space around each cell bgcolor="#00ff00" sets the background color for all cells to use these attributes you put them in the tag separated by a space like so
[IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/image1.jpg[/img] between the
tag and the
tag you can start making your columns and rows. for this we use these tags this is for the header but isn't nessersery the tables columns (the cells that go left to right) the tables rows (the cells that go up and down) these are set out like so [code]
header
cell 1 cell 2
cell 3 cell 4 cell 5
[/code] this looks like this [IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/image2.jpg[/img] some attributes for these are colspan="#" colums to span across rowspan="#" rows to span across width="#" sets width height="#" sets height bgcolor="#000000" sets background color for that cell these are used like so [code]
header
cell 1 cell 2
cell 3 cell 4 cell 5
[/code] this will give this table [IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/image3.jpg[/img]

item.title: [tut] html table basics
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:5, topic:61720”]xxlegit stfu

tables have their purpose

they are easier to use and much more user frienly than divs for newer people

plus some sites that display columns of data (myspace,runescape) tables are much more ideal then divs so dont go out and shoot old yellar too soon man[/quote]

Tbh, divs aren’t that much harder to learn than tables. You just need to learn float and clear, and its really not that difficult. And you could easily do columns of data with divs.

Tables have their purpose, but its not for layout.

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] html table basics
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:3, topic:61720”]No, I’m sorry. This guide is basically worthless, because you taught nothing of value. Tables are deprecated, as are anything that is style but not CSS. Always quote your values, such as in

, and you should still have tds inside th. Regardless, you should use divs, not tables.

You can find a prime example at:
http://www.qknotes.com[/quote]

xxlegit stfu

tables have their purpose

they are easier to use and much more user frienly than divs for newer people

plus some sites that display columns of data (myspace,runescape) tables are much more ideal then divs so dont go out and shoot old yellar too soon man

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] html table basics
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

No, I’m sorry. This guide is basically worthless, because you taught nothing of value. Tables are deprecated, as are anything that is style but not CSS. Always quote your values, such as in

, and you should still have tds inside th. Regardless, you should use divs, not tables.

You can find a prime example at:
http://www.qknotes.com

Read full topic

item.title: [tut] html table basics
item.dc:creator: @imjohn10 imjohn10
item.description:
@imjohn10 wrote:

[size=20pt]imjohn10’s guide to the basics of tables in html.[/size]

first you have to put the table tags on like so

[code]

[/code]

some common attributes for this are

border="#" sets the border size
cellpadding="#" space from text or picture to cell border
cellspaceing="#" space around each cell
bgcolor="#00ff00" sets the background color for all cells

to use these attributes you put them in the

tag separated by a space like so

between the

tag and the
tag you can start making your columns and rows.

for this we use these tags

this is for the header but isn't nessersery the tables columns (the cells that go left to right) the tables rows (the cells that go up and down)

these are set out like so

[code]

	<tr>
		<td>cell 3</td>
		<td>cell 4</td>
		<td>cell 5</td>
	</tr>
header
cell 1 cell 2
[/code]

this looks like this

some attributes for these are

colspan="#" colums to span across
rowspan="#" rows to span across
width="#" sets width
height="#" sets height
bgcolor="#000000" sets background color for that cell

these are used like so

[code]

	<tr>
		<td>cell 3</td>
		<td>cell 4</td>
		<td>cell 5</td>
	</tr>
header
cell 1 cell 2
[/code]

this will give this table
